channel.title: Toyota Celica, few questions
channel.description:
I bought a Toyota Celica about 2 days ago, it's a very nice car, I like it. But I have a few questions about it, which I didn't find answers on from google.
The headlights seem to be really powerless. I can't see jackshit at nights. When it rains I have to pull over and wait till the rain is over so I can see something. I've watched other cars headlights and they're much, much brighter, I want to know what I can do to fix the problem?
When I accelerate with high rpm, the car seems to tremble a lot, I'm not sure if it's normal or not.
How to know if the clutch is worn out? Currently the clutch grabs about 1-1,5cm from the default position.

item.title: Toyota Celica, few questions
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

If replacing the lights does nothing, then wiring, myb failing alternator…

What year, how many miles, and how many vaginas do you have?

Read full topic
